Comments_List: I had learned a proportion of what this class claimed to teach and I only took it to satisfy a requirement, but honestly, I found much better context for the skills I already, which in itself, helped me to improve these skills.
Calculus
As someone who didn't take calculus in high school, I learned a decent amount--though it was hard.
I have learned basic calculus that is applicable in other parts of my life besides math class
Better understanding of calculus concepts
We went through limits, derivatives, related rates, differential equations, integrals, and probably some other smaller things I'm forgetting about at the moment.
I learned basic calculus such as the IVT and the MVT. I learned how to calculate derivatives as well as basic integrals
I learned a lot
A basic understanding of calculus and its applications.
I like the grading policy and distribution, but I think widespread appeal and interest in the class could be improved.
I would have liked to do more work in class rather than so much lecturing
It feels very hard to do well on the exams because they are not similar to the practice exams

I thought the course was great, generally. The problem sets were fair, as were the exams, and lectures were good. My only complaint would be the fact that we used webassign. Webassign sometimes took off points for really frustrating simplification reasons, and I also had to pay a ridiculous amount of money to access those homework questions.
Good course but have more similar types of problems shown in class as to the exam questions.
I got a lot better at math

Strengths are that material needed for the tests are clearly presented in class. Weaknesses are that the test material is much harder than what is generally studied in class and the examples worked with throughout the course. Also the textbook is not easy to read or understand.
Yes
good refresher course if you took AB calc in HS but are worried about 115. Would definitely recommend taking before 115 if you need a calc refresher
Not unless you have to take it
I would if the student needed it for their major or an intended major
No, the lectures arent very interesting
Yes. I'm not the kind of person that would take a math course for fun, and even though I took it because it's a prerequisite, I thought it was alright.
I mean it's math. There isn't much to say.
I would a great calc base
Not unless it was a required for another class.
A good recap if you haven't taken AP calc in a while (or at all).
